New Records: Reynaldo López has the lowest ERA against the Phillies in three or more starts in a season by any pitcher since Jacob deGrom, who allowed no earned runs in 18 innings against them in 2018.
Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia homered twice, including a 421-foot two-out solo homer off Max Lazar in the sixth inning.
Reynaldo López worked six innings of one-run ball, allowing four hits and one walk with six strikeouts.
Sean Murphy homered after straining an oblique on Opening Day against the Phillies and spending two months on the IL.
Pre-Game Insights: Braves manager Brian Snitker mentioned that the team will take any help they can get, as they had been struggling to score runs.
Snitker referenced the Braves' three-game sweep against the Twins, where they hit.278 with a.341 OBP while outscoring Minnesota 23-13.
Post-Match Reflections: Snitker expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
López said his breaking ball and off-speed pitches were difference makers in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves are 7-4 against the Phillies and clinched the 13-game season series with the win.
The Braves remain five games behind the National League East-leading Phillies with 27 games left for each team, including their last two head-to-head this weekend.
Others: Orlando Arcia has three homers, two doubles, eight walks and an OPS near.850 in his past 11 games.
Matt Olson is finishing off easily his best month in a season that was shaping up as the worst of his career.
